ratings.comment: I took World History with him at McNeese. There are some comments here that shows some people don't pay attention. Pay attention in class. Do the works. You do OK. I'm a transfer student. He's very patient with me in class. He helped a lot in office hours. If you are a good student, you do well.
This class is literally the best. I wish all my classes were like this. There are a lot of youtube clips and music and images. It makes the class interesting. We also talk together a lot. It is fun.
This is actually the only class I do good in. The topics are all new to me. I don't do good in history. At least here, I can show up and do OK.
I like this class and the prof is pretty cool.
Awesome. Really like his class. Only a small amount of writing each week. Easy to pass if you just show up.

Really bad. I would not suggest taking this class with professor Billy if you are a full time student. I had no time to study for my other classes or do any other homework because he assigns so much reading material that you have to write an essay on at the end of each week. There is not a clear grading criteria he follows.

He relies so much on written work you do not have much time for the rest of your classes. mid-term is horrible. He did not give enough time to finish some portions of the exam. He did provide us with a study guide (it was over 20 pages) for the test, but it was two days before the test and he had an essay due during that time. I will be dropping...

I took the Asian Religions course. There were many short assignments to help learn the information, which was helpful, because we covered a lot. The readings were fine, and a few of them were amazing! There was a lot of opportunities for extra credit. We visited the museum for class and it was so fun! Exams are just exams. Can't change those.
Global History of Rap is a fun class. It was cool to learn about so many different music scenes. I loved learning about the languages too!
Huge lecture class, small discussion sections. Great talks and debates. He has knows a killer amount about immigration policy history.
Class was small, but fun! He won't take a weak argument, but he encourages a lot of debate and discussion.

Noseworthy is smart and he will make sure that you know it. He comes across as condescending at times, but he does take an interest in students and their lives if they speak to him. He is not an exceptionally tough grader, and he is willing to work with students to help them write essays and prepare for exams.

One of the best TAs I've had at UW! Always accessible during office hours & beyond, and gives feedback if you email him drafts of your paper before it's due. He & Prof Sweet offer a few EC opportunities and they're actually fun/interesting, take advantage of them! Made me think critically and challenged my perspective on Afro-descended history.
History of Rap is dope. The course uses a lot of social theory, and case studies. The assignments are difficult, but the final assignment and research paper were a lot of fun!
